TopicTitle: Symmetry around part vs. whole craft?

Articles.Content:
Say I have a rocket with a pair of boosters on the sides. I want to add something to the boosters and want the symmetry to be around each booster, not around the entire craft. 

For example, if I wanted to add 2 fins to each booster, I would turn on 2x symmetry which would make each fin appear once on each booster, because the symmetry is centered around the craft. But what if I wanted each fin to attach twice symmetrically on a single booster, meaning the symmetry is around the booster itself?

Not sure if I'm bringing my point across clearly, but basically I want to know if/how this can be done.

Thanks!!
Use only 1 booster, customize that. Then, use symmetry to copy the customize the booster/part.

There is a button that toggles between symmetry on the vessel and symmetry on the part you're attaching to. Checking the wiki, it's the F key.

depending on what exactly you want, you might want to try out the subassembly feature.

it takes some thinking/trail-n-error before you start, but sometimes it helps.

i generally use it for probes or small landers. i make one (starting with an upside down docking port) with the desired radial symmetry and save it as subassembly (root part being the lower, up-facing docking port). while building my main stage i can just add the lander as a part, symmetry preserved.
